MIS INTERNSHIP AT GREEN BHUMI About Green Bhumi: Green Bhumi is a vibrant platform dedicated to fostering environmentalconsciousness and action globally. At the heart of our initiative lies theestablishment and promotion of environmentalism and fosteringcommunity engagement through impactful environmental activism. Green Bhumi is a flagship project under the Top Trove Foundation thatenvisions a life free from pollution and enriched with fresh air. Ourmission is to inspire and empower communities to plant trees,harnessing nature's positive impact on lives while contributing tosocio-economic well-being. About the Internship: We are looking for detail-oriented and organized MIS Interns to assist inmanaging crucial documentation and ensure the smooth preparation ofofficial certificates. This role is an excellent opportunity to gain practicalexperience in documentation and management systems whilecontributing to Green Bhumi's mission. Duration: 3 months Type: Remote/Work From Home Internship Stipend: Unpaid Internship Key Responsibilities: â— Prepare official documents such as offer letters, certificates ofcompletion (CoC), and letters of recommendation (LoR). â— Maintain accurate and organized records of all prepareddocuments. â— Ensure timely delivery of certificates to the respective teams orindividuals. â— Collaborate with the other teams to verify details for certificates. â— Assist in managing and updating the database for documenttracking and management. â— Support process improvement efforts for document preparationand management. Requirements:â— Strong organizational and time-management skills. â— Proficiency in MS Excel or Google Workspace tools. â— Knowledge about Canva and mailing documents â— Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation. â— Good communication skills for coordinating with team members. â— Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. â— Prior experience in document management is a plus but notmandatory. Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion. â— Letter of Recommendation (performance-based). â— Promotions during the Internship (performance-based). â— Recognition on Social Media (performance-based). â— Hands-on experience in managing and preparing officialdocuments. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and enhanceprofessional skills. â— Flexible working hours. How to Apply: Interested candidates can send their CV/Resume to [priyaldubey2@gmail.com] with thesubject line â€œMIS Internship Application.â€hashtag#misinternship hashtag#internships hashtag#careers hashtag#opportunity hashtag#freshers hashtag#hiring hashtag#experience hashtag#toptrovefoundation TopTrove Foundation

At the heart of our initiative lies theestablishment and promotion of environmentalism and fosteringcommunity engagement through impactful environmental activism. Requirements:â— Strong organizational and time-management skills. â— Proficiency in MS Excel or Google Workspace tools. â— Knowledge about Canva and mailing documents â— Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation. â— Good communication skills for coordinating with team members. â— Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. â— Prior experience in document management is a plus but notmandatory. Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion. â— Letter of Recommendation (performance-based). â— Promotions during the Internship (performance-based). â— Recognition on Social Media (performance-based). â— Hands-on experience in managing and preparing officialdocuments. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and enhanceprofessional skills. â— Flexible working hours. Requirements:â— Strong organizational and time-management skills. â— Proficiency in MS Excel or Google Workspace tools. â— Knowledge about Canva and mailing documents â— Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation. â— Good communication skills for coordinating with team members. â— Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. â— Prior experience in document management is a plus but notmandatory. Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion. â— Letter of Recommendation (performance-based). â— Promotions during the Internship (performance-based). â— Recognition on Social Media (performance-based). â— Hands-on experience in managing and preparing officialdocuments. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and enhanceprofessional skills. â— Flexible working hours. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

Requirements:â— Strong organizational and time-management skills. â— Proficiency in MS Excel or Google Workspace tools. â— Knowledge about Canva and mailing documents â— Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation. â— Good communication skills for coordinating with team members. â— Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. â— Prior experience in document management is a plus but notmandatory. Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion. â— Letter of Recommendation (performance-based). â— Promotions during the Internship (performance-based). â— Recognition on Social Media (performance-based). â— Hands-on experience in managing and preparing officialdocuments. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and enhanceprofessional skills. â— Flexible working hours. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

Requirements:â— Strong organizational and time-management skills. â— Proficiency in MS Excel or Google Workspace tools. â— Knowledge about Canva and mailing documents â— Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation. â— Good communication skills for coordinating with team members. â— Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. â— Prior experience in document management is a plus but notmandatory. Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion. â— Letter of Recommendation (performance-based). â— Promotions during the Internship (performance-based). â— Recognition on Social Media (performance-based). â— Hands-on experience in managing and preparing officialdocuments. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and enhanceprofessional skills. â— Flexible working hours. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

Requirements:â— Strong organizational and time-management skills. â— Proficiency in MS Excel or Google Workspace tools. â— Knowledge about Canva and mailing documents â— Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation. â— Good communication skills for coordinating with team members. â— Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. â— Prior experience in document management is a plus but notmandatory. Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion. â— Letter of Recommendation (performance-based). â— Promotions during the Internship (performance-based). â— Recognition on Social Media (performance-based). â— Hands-on experience in managing and preparing officialdocuments. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and enhanceprofessional skills. â— Flexible working hours. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

MIS INTERNSHIP AT GREEN BHUMI About Green Bhumi: Green Bhumi is a vibrant platform dedicated to fostering environmentalconsciousness and action globally. At the heart of our initiative lies theestablishment and promotion of environmentalism and fosteringcommunity engagement through impactful environmental activism. Green Bhumi is a flagship project under the Top Trove Foundation thatenvisions a life free from pollution and enriched with fresh air. Ourmission is to inspire and empower communities to plant trees,harnessing nature's positive impact on lives while contributing tosocio-economic well-being. About the Internship: We are looking for detail-oriented and organized MIS Interns to assist inmanaging crucial documentation and ensure the smooth preparation ofofficial certificates. This role is an excellent opportunity to gain practicalexperience in documentation and management systems whilecontributing to Green Bhumi's mission. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. Requirements:â— Strong organizational and time-management skills. â— Proficiency in MS Excel or Google Workspace tools. â— Knowledge about Canva and mailing documents â— Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation. â— Good communication skills for coordinating with team members. â— Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. â— Prior experience in document management is a plus but notmandatory. Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion. â— Letter of Recommendation (performance-based). â— Promotions during the Internship (performance-based). â— Recognition on Social Media (performance-based). â— Hands-on experience in managing and preparing officialdocuments. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and enhanceprofessional skills. â— Flexible working hours. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. MIS INTERNSHIP AT GREEN BHUMI About Green Bhumi: Green Bhumi is a vibrant platform dedicated to fostering environmentalconsciousness and action globally. At the heart of our initiative lies theestablishment and promotion of environmentalism and fosteringcommunity engagement through impactful environmental activism. Green Bhumi is a flagship project under the Top Trove Foundation thatenvisions a life free from pollution and enriched with fresh air. Ourmission is to inspire and empower communities to plant trees,harnessing nature's positive impact on lives while contributing tosocio-economic well-being. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

Requirements:â— Strong organizational and time-management skills. â— Proficiency in MS Excel or Google Workspace tools. â— Knowledge about Canva and mailing documents â— Attention to detail and accuracy in documentation. â— Good communication skills for coordinating with team members. â— Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. â— Prior experience in document management is a plus but notmandatory. Benefits: â— Certificate of Completion. â— Letter of Recommendation (performance-based). â— Promotions during the Internship (performance-based). â— Recognition on Social Media (performance-based). â— Hands-on experience in managing and preparing officialdocuments. â— Opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause and enhanceprofessional skills. â— Flexible working hours. Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome

Lately, Iâ€™ve been noticing a troubling shift in the job market. Full-time jobs, especially entry-level ones, are being replaced by internships and part-time roles. While gaining experience is important, this trend is leading to an underpaid work culture where employees' skills are being exploited for higher profits but lower salaries.Iâ€™m not talking about corporate offices with high-paying roles. Iâ€™m talking about industries where freshers used to earn double what they do now, but today, those roles are disguised as internships or contract-based jobs with minimal pay and no job security.If this continues, weâ€™ll see:âŒ More skilled individuals being undervaluedâŒ Reduced financial stability for young professionalsâŒ A never-ending cycle of internships with no full-time employmentHow Can We Change This?âœ… Companies should offer fair wages even for freshers and entry-level roles.âœ… Internships should lead to actual job opportunities, not just temporary work.âœ… Employers need to value skill over free/cheap labor.âœ… Candidates should negotiate and not settle for low-paid roles that donâ€™t respect their worth.The job market should empower professionals, not use their skills without fair compensation. What do you think? Have you noticed this shift in your industry? Letâ€™s discuss.hashtag#Jobmarket hashtag#internshipculture hashtag#hiring hashtag#employees hashtag#workfromhome
